commitResults.messageBody:
Initially Appointment.class only had one String attribute which
was value. Appointment details were assigned to value. However since
sort feature require Appointment.class to have dateTime attribute,
updates were made to Appointment.class to account for these
requirements.

clearing appointment details by the AppointmentCommand itself.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update user guide with diet command
commitResults.messageBody: Minor change in find description.

Current tag allows only 1 word.

Some breeds have 2 words or more so need to change parsing of tags.

Use VALIDATION_REGEX = "\\s*\\p{Alnum}[\\p{Alnum}\\s]*" instead of
VALIDATION_REGEX = "\\p{Alnum}+".

Allow any number of white spaces to precede before alpha-numeric
characters, and any number of white space in between or after alpha-
numeric characters.

Attendance command takes in att/dd-MM-yyyy pu/HH:mm do/HH:mm and
stores the 3 fields inside a json file specific to the pet in data/pets.

Add AttendanceCommand.java class similar to EditCommand.java class.
Add AttendanceCommandParser.java class.
Add case in AddressBookParser.java
Add new syntax in CliSyntax: PREFIX_DROP_OFF, PREFIX_PICK_UP,
PREFIX_ATTENDANCE_DATE.
Add new parser methods for date and time in ParserUtil.java
Remove line to delete individual pet's json file in JsonAddressBookStorage.java
every time saveAddressBook() is called.

Update user guide with attendance command.
Update AttendanceCommand.java createAttendanceForPet() method.
Update JsonAddressBookStorage.java

Add a pet to address book will create a JSON file and a txt file for the pet if it has
not been created already.
Attendance command takes in an index, date, pick up time and drop off time.
Command will be parsed to LocalDate, LocalTime and LocalTime respectively.
createAttendanceForPet() command takes in the parsed commands, adds them as
test in pet's txt file, sorts the txt file, reads it and outputs it as JSON file.

To be implemented: Optional fields such as pu/ and do/, time command to display
the pickup and drop off time, how to display them in GUI.

Makes code neater and methods shorter.
Improve abstraction.
Fixed minor bugs.
Use `attd` instead of `attendance`. Update user doc.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix minor issue in user guide formatting

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently does not have filter feature in DG.

Update DG with filter feature section, with sequence diagram and activity diagram.
Filter section is tentative and subject to changes along the way as feature is being
implemented.

Add filter by tags and filter by owners.
Tag can only filter if they are exact. Need to work on partial match and
case insensitive matches.
Filter by owners can do partial and case insensitive filter.

Filter command can take in fields: byDate/, byOwner/ and byTag/
Created FilterUtil class to help match tags and check if user only enters
one filter field. Allow for better abstraction.
Tag is able to match more than 1 word and also account for typo errors
made by user such as typing "Borde Colli" instead of "Border Collie".
FilterCommand takes in FilterByContainsFilterWordPredicate. This is an
abstract class that is implemented by the three other classes which
corresponds to each filter field. Having an abstract class allows filter command
to take in different types of predicate classes which performs different types of
test on Pet and filter them accordingly.

Fix minor clarity issues in previous commands, add filter command
and update command table with filter and sort commands.

Need to replace original UML diagrams for AB3 with 'Pet' instead of
'Person'.

Previously only filter by date, tags and owners names.

to LocalDate.

commitResults.messageBody:
- Current implementation does not allow for sorting.

- Sorting should be allowed so that pet owners can find pets easier via alphabetical order.

- As such, we can add a sort command that allows the pet owners to set the pets by their name.

- The Name class must be comparable in order for us to do so.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add tests for the sort command
Implement a more general version of sort.
commitResults.messageBody: - Now, users will be able to sort the pet list by both name and ownername.
- Included the sort command as one of the new features.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, we are unable to undo any of the commands in WoofAreYou.

It is necessary to have such a command so that users can undo accidental commands.

The current undo implementation makes use of an arraylist with a pointer that points to the current state.

commitResults.messageBody:
The previous implementation used a Json and text file to store
attendance data for pets. This caused dependencies between many
components due to a lack of separation of concerns.

Splitting up the functionality into subclasses improves code quality.

To improve on OOP, let's extract out relevant methods and classes used
by the attendance command. Doing so will make subsequent usage of the
class and related functionalities easier.

commitResults.messageBody:
Since the given date-time is in English, we should use Locale.ENGLISH
with our DateTimeFormatter in Appointment.java, if not parsing dates
would fail in systems with non-English locales.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update timing validity check in PresentAttendance
commitResults.messageBody:
The pick-up and drop-off times were checked only after the creation of
a new PresentAttendanceEntry object.

Let's make it so that before creating the entry, we check and validate
the timings that are given by the user.
